trans-unit.source: How do bridges resolve agreements at runtime?
trans-unit.target: How do bridges resolve agreements at runtime?

trans-unit.source: How <token>bridge</token>s resolve to agreements at runtime.
trans-unit.target: How <token>bridge</token>s resolve to agreements at runtime.

trans-unit.source: How do bridges resolve to agreements?
trans-unit.target: How do bridges resolve to agreements?

trans-unit.source: Agreement type
trans-unit.target: Agreement type

trans-unit.source: How the resolution happens
trans-unit.target: How the resolution happens

trans-unit.source: Any user input required?
trans-unit.target: Any user input required?

trans-unit.source: EDI receive agreement (X12 and EDIFACT)
trans-unit.target: EDI receive agreement (X12 and EDIFACT)

trans-unit.source: The identities (ISA for X12 and UNB for EDIFACT) in the received message are matched with the identities specified in an agreement.
trans-unit.target: The identities (ISA for X12 and UNB for EDIFACT) in the received message are matched with the identities specified in an agreement.

trans-unit.source: If a match happens, that agreement is used for message processing.
trans-unit.target: If a match happens, that agreement is used for message processing.

trans-unit.source: If the match fails, the message is suspended.
trans-unit.target: If the match fails, the message is suspended.

trans-unit.source: The EDI message sent to the bridge must include the identities (ISA and UNB).
trans-unit.target: The EDI message sent to the bridge must include the identities (ISA and UNB).

trans-unit.source: The bridge promotes the identity values, which are used for agreement resolution.
trans-unit.target: The bridge promotes the identity values, which are used for agreement resolution.

trans-unit.source: EDI send agreement (X12 and EDIFACT)
trans-unit.target: EDI send agreement (X12 and EDIFACT)

trans-unit.source: The resolution happens in the following order:
trans-unit.target: The resolution happens in the following order:

trans-unit.source: Agreement ID
trans-unit.target: Agreement ID

trans-unit.source: Combination of agreement name and partners
trans-unit.target: Combination of agreement name and partners

trans-unit.source: The identities in the agreement
trans-unit.target: The identities in the agreement

trans-unit.source: The EDI message sent to the bridge must include one of the following as part of the header:
trans-unit.target: The EDI message sent to the bridge must include one of the following as part of the header:

trans-unit.source: “AgreementID”
trans-unit.target: “AgreementID”

trans-unit.source: “AgreementName”, “HostPartner”, and “GuestPartner”
trans-unit.target: “AgreementName”, “HostPartner”, and “GuestPartner”

trans-unit.source: “SenderIdentifier”, “SenderQualifier”, “ReceiverIdentifier”, and “ReceiverQualifier”
trans-unit.target: “SenderIdentifier”, “SenderQualifier”, “ReceiverIdentifier”, and “ReceiverQualifier”

trans-unit.source: The bridge promotes these values; which are used for agreement resolution.
trans-unit.target: The bridge promotes these values; which are used for agreement resolution.

trans-unit.source: If an incorrect agreement ID is included in the message header and subsequently promoted by the bridge, the agreement resolution fails and the message is suspended.
trans-unit.target: If an incorrect agreement ID is included in the message header and subsequently promoted by the bridge, the agreement resolution fails and the message is suspended.

trans-unit.source: If agreement and partner names are present in the header, they are promoted by the bridge.
trans-unit.target: If agreement and partner names are present in the header, they are promoted by the bridge.

trans-unit.source: If the agreement resolution fails because of incorrect agreement and partner names, the message is suspended.
trans-unit.target: If the agreement resolution fails because of incorrect agreement and partner names, the message is suspended.

trans-unit.source: If the identities are preset in the header, they are promoted and used for message resolution.
trans-unit.target: If the identities are preset in the header, they are promoted and used for message resolution.

trans-unit.source: If none of the above values are promoted, agreement resolution fails and the message is suspended.
trans-unit.target: If none of the above values are promoted, agreement resolution fails and the message is suspended.

trans-unit.source: For bridges that were deployed before the August update, if none of the properties are present as part of the header, the messages will be processed with the agreement with which they were deployed before the August update.
trans-unit.target: For bridges that were deployed before the August update, if none of the properties are present as part of the header, the messages will be processed with the agreement with which they were deployed before the August update.

trans-unit.source: However, if the old bridges are redeployed after the August update, the message sent to the bridges must include the properties in the header, or else the message is suspended.
trans-unit.target: However, if the old bridges are redeployed after the August update, the message sent to the bridges must include the properties in the header, or else the message is suspended.

trans-unit.source: AS2 receive
trans-unit.target: AS2 receive

trans-unit.source: The resolution happens based on the AS2-To and AS2-From values specified in the agreement.
trans-unit.target: The resolution happens based on the AS2-To and AS2-From values specified in the agreement.

trans-unit.source: “AS2-To”, “AS2-From”, and “AS2-MessageID” values must be included as per the standard AS2 protocol.
trans-unit.target: “AS2-To”, “AS2-From”, and “AS2-MessageID” values must be included as per the standard AS2 protocol.

trans-unit.source: The bridge promotes these values, which are then used to match with the values specified in an AS2 agreement.
trans-unit.target: The bridge promotes these values, which are then used to match with the values specified in an AS2 agreement.

trans-unit.source: AS2 send
trans-unit.target: AS2 send

trans-unit.source: The resolution happens based on the AS2-To and AS2-From values specified in the agreement.
trans-unit.target: The resolution happens based on the AS2-To and AS2-From values specified in the agreement.

trans-unit.source: “AS2-To” and “AS2-From” must be included in the message header.
trans-unit.target: “AS2-To” and “AS2-From” must be included in the message header.

trans-unit.source: The bridge promotes these values, which are then used to match with the values specified in an AS2 agreement.
trans-unit.target: The bridge promotes these values, which are then used to match with the values specified in an AS2 agreement.

trans-unit.source: What happens to agreements created before the August’ 14 refresh?
trans-unit.target: What happens to agreements created before the August’ 14 refresh?

trans-unit.source: As part of the August ’14 refresh of <token>af_integration_full</token>, agreement created in <token>tpm_portal</token>, and the underlying bridges are decoupled.
trans-unit.target: As part of the August ’14 refresh of <token>af_integration_full</token>, agreement created in <token>tpm_portal</token>, and the underlying bridges are decoupled.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides information on how this impacts the existing agreements in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides information on how this impacts the existing agreements in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: Before August’ 14 refresh
trans-unit.target: Before August’ 14 refresh

trans-unit.source: After August’ 14 refresh
trans-unit.target: After August’ 14 refresh

trans-unit.source: Agreement
trans-unit.target: Agreement

trans-unit.source: Agreement exists in the <token>tpm_portal</token> with a name and an ID.
trans-unit.target: Agreement exists in the <token>tpm_portal</token> with a name and an ID.

trans-unit.source: Agreements have two bridges underneath; one for send and another for receive, dedicated to the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Agreements have two bridges underneath; one for send and another for receive, dedicated to the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Agreement configuration includes identities, protocol, batch, transform, and transport/route settings.
trans-unit.target: Agreement configuration includes identities, protocol, batch, transform, and transport/route settings.

trans-unit.source: Agreement exists in the <token>tpm_portal</token> with a name and an ID.
trans-unit.target: Agreement exists in the <token>tpm_portal</token> with a name and an ID.

trans-unit.source: Agreement configuration includes identities, protocol, and batch settings.
trans-unit.target: Agreement configuration includes identities, protocol, and batch settings.

trans-unit.source: Bridge
trans-unit.target: Bridge

trans-unit.source: Underlying <token>bridge</token>s are listed in the <embeddedLabel>Bridges</embeddedLabel> tab of the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: Underlying <token>bridge</token>s are listed in the <embeddedLabel>Bridges</embeddedLabel> tab of the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: The <token>bridge</token> view is just a listing.
trans-unit.target: The <token>bridge</token> view is just a listing.

trans-unit.source: You cannot click on a <token>bridge</token> to edit its configuration.
trans-unit.target: You cannot click on a <token>bridge</token> to edit its configuration.

trans-unit.source: The EDI <token>bridge</token>s cannot be deleted from the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: The EDI <token>bridge</token>s cannot be deleted from the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: The <token>bridge</token>s that were earlier associated with an agreement are now listed with their uniquely identifiable URLs.
trans-unit.target: The <token>bridge</token>s that were earlier associated with an agreement are now listed with their uniquely identifiable URLs.

trans-unit.source: The <token>bridge</token>s do not have a name.
trans-unit.target: The <token>bridge</token>s do not have a name.

trans-unit.source: You can click on a bridge to edit its configuration properties.
trans-unit.target: You can click on a bridge to edit its configuration properties.

trans-unit.source: <token>Bridge</token>s are still listed as send and receive side, each denoting a separate <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: <token>Bridge</token>s are still listed as send and receive side, each denoting a separate <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: EDI <token>bridge</token>s can be deleted from the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: EDI <token>bridge</token>s can be deleted from the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: Schemas
trans-unit.target: Schemas

trans-unit.source: Schemas are included as part of agreement configuration.
trans-unit.target: Schemas are included as part of agreement configuration.

trans-unit.source: Schemas continue to be included as part of agreement configuration.
trans-unit.target: Schemas continue to be included as part of agreement configuration.

trans-unit.source: Transforms
trans-unit.target: Transforms

trans-unit.source: Transforms are included as part of agreement configuration
trans-unit.target: Transforms are included as part of agreement configuration

trans-unit.source: Transform are included as part of <token>bridge</token> configuration.
trans-unit.target: Transform are included as part of <token>bridge</token> configuration.

trans-unit.source: Tracking and archiving
trans-unit.target: Tracking and archiving

trans-unit.source: Tracking and archiving is part of agreement configuration
trans-unit.target: Tracking and archiving is part of agreement configuration

trans-unit.source: Tracking and archiving is part of bridge configuration.
trans-unit.target: Tracking and archiving is part of bridge configuration.

trans-unit.source: Route acks as flat file
trans-unit.target: Route acks as flat file

trans-unit.source: The configuration option is included as part of agreement configuration
trans-unit.target: The configuration option is included as part of agreement configuration

trans-unit.source: The configuration option is included as part of bridge configuration.
trans-unit.target: The configuration option is included as part of bridge configuration.
